html: Persons spiritually “redeemed” by Jehovah (Isaiah 43:1; 44:22) and physically “ransomed” by righteousness (Isaiah 1:27; 51:1)—Jehovah’s servant (Isaiah 41:2; 46:11-13)—return to Zion in the exodus of Jehovah’s elect from throughout the earth (Isaiah 11:10-12; 51:9-11). Where sorrow and sighing were once the lot of Jehovah’s people (Isaiah 21:3; 29:2), now everlasting joy and gladness take their place (Isaiah 55:12; 61:7). The covenant blessings that were conditional on his people’s faithfulness through trials (Isaiah 26:2-3; 33:6) now become eternal and unconditional (Isaiah 54:10; 61:8).
